value.0: <StartAction>[Much to your surprise, the golems in this room do not attack you. A single construct, seemingly made of the flesh of demons, steps forward to address you.]</Start>
We have no quarrel with you, <race> <male/female>. I am Aghaaz, high priest of the Maker and leader of the sentient golems on this island.
<StartAction>[Aghaaz screams in rage.]</Start> I shall crush you into dust!
Though golems, we are different than the mindless constructs that wander the level above. We are creatures of intelligence and will, beings of true self-awareness.

We are the children of Alsigard the Maker, who gave us the gift of life itself. Being the strongest, the Maker saw fit to anoint me his high priest, to deliver his word and will to his other children.
When the Maker descended to his inner sanctum, we were given the task of guarding this place from those who would destroy his work, like the duergar who loot the remains of our fallen siblings.
But I sense you are not like those duergar thieves. It seems you have come here for a different reason. That is why we parley with you now under a state of truce.
<StartAction>[Aghaaz laughs, a deep, rumbling sound.]</Start> A series of mistakes and misfortunes. The golems in the level above know no better, they have no will of their own.
As for those of us on this level, at first we thought you were common thieves, like the duergar who loot the level above. Later, we feared you might be working for the heretic Ferron.
This is a time of war. Those who are not our allies are assumed to be enemies, even a non-construct such as you. I apologize for this, but it is Ferron who has driven us to this.
Goodbye, <race> <male/female>.
Wait, <race> <male/female>. You are strong, I have seen the carnage you have wrought in this level. I have an offer for you.

Comment.value: Agreed to destroy Ferron, Ferron still lives

value.0: Goodbye, <race> <male/female>. I wish you success against Ferron and his blasphemous followers.
Bring me the head of the heretic and, when the time comes, I will send my golems to aid you in your battle against the Valsharess.
Long have we served the will of the Maker, living in peace while we guard this island against those who would destroy his divine work. But now an enemy has risen up from among our own ranks.
A golem known as Ferron has turned his back on the divine word. He claims we owe the Maker nothing, and we are free to do whatever we please. His lies have fooled many of the Maker's children.
Ferron has turned many of the golems against me, the rightful ruler in the Maker's absence. He has brought violence to these halls, but the war is not easily won. Both sides are too evenly matched.
<StartAction>[Aghaaz bares his teeth.]</Start> You are either with me or against me, <race> <male/female>. Choose wisely.
Choose your words with care, <FirstName>. Golems are formidable in battle. They could be valuable allies... or dangerous enemies.
This might be a good time for tact and diplomacy, <FirstName>. These golems could be valuable allies against the Valsharess.
Oh-oh, Boss. Deekin thinks golem getting mad. Look - his nostrils flaring now!
I only want to end this war. Golem against golem is a terrible thing, we are destroying what the Maker has created. But Ferron will not rest until I am overthrown.
I want you to find Ferron and destroy him. Without their leader, his vile teachings will wither and die. Bring me Ferron's head and you will forever be an ally of the Maker's children.
<StartAction>[Aghaaz bares his teeth.]</Start> You are either with me or against me, <race> <male/female>. Choose wisely.
Choose your words with care, <FirstName>. Golems are formidable in battle. They could be valuable allies... or dangerous enemies.
This might be a good time for tact and diplomacy, <FirstName>. These golems could be valuable allies against the Valsharess.
Oh-oh, Boss. Deekin thinks golem getting mad. Look - his nostrils flaring now!
<StartAction>[Aghaaz listens as you describe the Valsharess, then nods.]</Start> If you destroy Ferron, I will send golems to aid your rebels in their battle against the Valsharess.
Return to me with Ferron's head to prove the heretic has been destroyed and I will honor my end of the bargain. Now, is there something else you need?
Return to me with Ferron's head to prove the heretic has been destroyed and I will honor my end of the bargain. Now, is there something else you need?
We should be careful here, <FirstName>. I know how strongly people can feel about their beliefs. We don't want to get caught up in the middle of a religious war.
So you attacked us without even bothering to find out who we were or what we wanted?
Hmph! Why it always got to be the biggest or strongest or smartest who gets to be in charge? Deekin never get picked that way.

We are the children of Alsigard the Maker, who gave us the gift of life itself. Being the strongest, the Maker saw fit to anoint me his high priest, to deliver his word and will to his other children.
Though golems, we are different than the mindless constructs that wander the level above. We are creatures of intelligence and will, beings of true self-awareness.
<StartAction>[Aghaaz grins at your approach, a truly disturbing sight.]</Start>Back again? What do you want now, <race> <male/female>?
You are unfamiliar with our beliefs, so I will let your words pass. But you would be wise not to make such blasphemous claims about the Maker again. Now, is there anything else you need?
<StartAction>[Aghaaz's lips curl into a feral snarl. He steps closer to you and speaks in a harsh whisper.]</Start> I am the High priest of the Maker. If he dies, my claim to power dies with him.
I have been appointed to rule until the Maker returns. The Maker cannot die, but if he chooses to never return, then my rule shall go on forever. Do you understand?
<StartAction>[Aghaaz rises up to his full height, his voice bellowing out across the chamber.]</Start>Destroy these heretics! Destroy them in the name of the Immortal Maker!
<StartAction>[Valen leans over and whispers in your ear.]</Start> A word of advice, <FirstName>: those in power don't enjoy seeing their positions threatened!
<StartAction>[Nathyrra leans over and whispers in your ear.]</Start> A word of advice, <FirstName>: those in power don't enjoy seeing their positions threatened!
As the Maker's anointed, it is my duty to share wisdom with others. What is it you would know?
Ferron was once one of us, a Child of the Maker. But even though Alsigard gave Ferron life, he refuses to acknowledge his debt to the Maker.
Ferron claims we should leave this place. He refuses to acknowledge my position as the Maker's anointed. And he has spread his heresy to many of the other golems here.
Now we wage an endless war against Ferron and his followers. But in the end, I know we shall emerge victorious. It is the Maker's will.
We are the Maker's Children, the faithful servants of Alsigard. When the Maker left he anointed me as his High Priest, to rule until his glorious return.
For many centuries we have dwelt here in these hallowed halls, defending them against looters and thieves who are not worthy of the Maker. Until recently, my rule was a peaceful one.
But some defile our sacred trust. Some claim we should ignore our sworn duty to serve the Maker and abandon this place. The leader of these heretics is one called Ferron.
As you know, we were forced into a war by Ferron and his heretical followers. But now that you have slain him, peace and order will once again rule the golems as we wait for the Maker's return.
The Maker's true name is Alsigard. Long ago he dwelt with the rest of the duergar. But in his infinite wisdom, he came to see the failings of his own kind. Their flaws filled him with disgust.
Alsigard came to this island to escape his flawed brethren. Here he found the solitude to create what nature could not: a perfect being. A creature worthy of dwelling in the Maker's presence.
I and the other golems here are the result of his quest for perfection. Alsigard gave us life, and now we repay him by guarding his laboratory against those who are unworthy of the Maker's secrets.
We obey the will of the maker. Five centuries may have passed, but unlike a being of flesh our devotion will not waver. We constructs are made of sterner stuff than you.
Be careful, creature of flesh. Your words come close to the heresy of Ferron. We have been commanded by the Maker to await his return. We must obey.
I believe your words were intended as an insult, but I take them as a compliment.
Some would say our society is stagnant, I would say it is enduring. You see things in the narrow world of a finite, flesh-bound life. But our existence transcends yours.
The Maker disappeared into the very depths of the dungeon, though I cannot say why. The will of the Maker is too great for a mere construct such as myself to divine.
But before he left gave the mantle of leadership to me, the strongest of his children. Anointed by the Maker's own hand, I rule the golems as we await the great Maker's return.
We were instructed to wait. We were not instructed to look for the Master. Why would we disobey his will simply because 500 years have passed?
I am not so full of hubris as to make that claim. The Maker alone is perfect, we are only the shadows of perfection. But by serving his will can we bring ourselves closer to true perfection.
<StartAction>[Aghaaz spits in disgust.]</Start> You are working for Ferron? Why should I not kill you where you stand?
<StartAction>[Aghaaz fixes one of his glowing eyes on you.] </Start>You seem to be a creature of great power. Why are you serving Ferron?
So Ferron has promised golems to aid you against this Valsharess? Very well, I will promise you the same.
Destroy Ferron for me, and I will send my golems to aid your rebels in their battle against the Valsharess.
Think carefully, <race> <male/female>. You are either with me or against me.
Ferron is a heretic. He defies the will of the Maker and he challenges my right to rule as the Maker's anointed. He wants us to abandon this place, to turn our backs on the Maker.
There can never be peace while Ferron and his followers exist. They are an affront to everything the Maker stands for, and they must be destroyed before the Maker's glorious return.
<StartAction>[Aghaaz snarls at you, his lips curling up to reveal his pointed teeth.]</Start> Lies spread by Ferron! The Maker will return. Until then, I rule the golems on his behalf!
<StartAction>[The demon-golem steps closer to you, his voice a harsh whisper.]</Start> I am the High priest of the Maker. If he dies, my claim to power dies with him.
I have been appointed to rule until the Maker returns. The Maker cannot die, but if he chooses to never return, then my rule shall go on forever. Do you understand?
<StartAction>[Aghaaz nods, satisfied you understand the meaning behind his words.] </Start>Faith is a delicate thing. We must protect them against those who try to tear it down. Those like Ferron.
<StartAction>[Aghaaz's takes the head from you, his booming laugh echoing off the walls.]</Start> Ha-ha-ha! The heretic is slain! Ferron is dead, and his followers shall soon join him!
Well done, <race> <male/female>. You have delivered your promise, and now I shall deliver on mine. When you move against the Valsharess, golems will join your army in battle.
You have proven yourself as an ally of the Maker's Children. It's too bad you aren't a golem yourself, or I would make you my second-in-command.

I should caution you not to venture deeper into these ruins. The Maker himself is not to be disturbed, even if you can reach him. You might have managed to tear the traitor Ferron to pieces, but our master's power is greater still.
Deekin thinks it too bad Ferron be dead. He may be justs a bunch of metal, but he makes neat sounds when he gets smacked. He be likes a walking drum. Deekin wanted to do duet with him.
<StartAction>[As Aghaaz is laughing, you hear Valen mutter under his breath.]</Start> I know Ferron was naught but a golem, yet I can't help but feel some regret at his passing.
<StartAction>[As Aghaaz is laughing, you hear Nathyrra mutter under her breath.]</Start> I know Ferron was naught but a golem, yet I can't help but feel some regret at his passing.
<StartAction>[Aghaaz grins at your approach, a truly disturbing sight.]</Start> Welcome once again, <race> <male/female>. Do not worry, I have not forgotten my promise to you.
When the time comes my golems will march with you against this Valsharess you spoke of. Or are you here for some other reason?
Get out of my sight, before I beat you to a pulp!
You are an abomination that must be destroyed!
You're pretty well spoken, for a golem.
Enough talking. Time to die, golem!
Parley? Golems have been attacking me ever since I got here!
I should be going now.
Why are you at war?
Who's Ferron?
Sorry, I'm not interested in this.
Then I'm against you.
Nobody threatens me!
Fine. What is it you want me to do?
And you want my help?
Forget it! I'm not your errand <boy/girl>.
If I help you, you have to help me. <StartAction>[Tell Aghaaz about the Valsharess.]</Start>
High priest of the Maker?
Sentient golems? What are you talking about?

LinkComment.value: Agreed to destroy Ferron, Ferron still lives

value.0: I'll be back once Ferron is dead.
You should know something: the Maker is dead.
Sorry. Forget I mentioned it.
It's true. He abandoned you all and became a demi-lich.
I'm speaking the truth. I killed him myself.
I won't help spread a lie. The Maker is dead!
I want to ask you some questions.
Tell me about Ferron and his followers.
Tell me about yourself and your followers.
Tell me about the Maker.
I want to ask you something else.
So you just sit around and wait for him to return?
Isn't it obvious by now he isn't coming back?
After five centuries, isn't it time to move on?
Can't you see that your society is stagnating?
For a sentient creature, you still think like a construct.
Where is the Maker now?
Why haven't you gone to look for the Maker?
So you claim to be a perfect being?
Ferron sent me to get the Power Source from you.
You could try to kill me. You'd fail, but you could try.
Enough of this. Give me the power source or die!
Okay, you've got a deal.
I don't want to get involved in this.
Forget it! I'm not your errand <boy/girl>!
I won't betray Ferron!
Then I'm against you.
Ferron's arguments make sense.
I guess I'll just have to kill you then.
Ferron wants the power source. If you're smart, you'll give it to me.
Ferron warned me you might be unreasonable.
You should know something: the Maker is dead.
It's no lie. I killed the Maker myself.
I get it. Don't worry, I won't mention this again.
Here is Ferron's head.
<StartAction>Leave.</Start>
You're welcome to try your best.
